frame.name: Telling
frame.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Speaker</fen> addresses an <fen>Addressee</fen> with a <fen>Message</fen>, which may be indirectly referred to as a <fen>Topic</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Speaker
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that produces the <fen>Message</fen>. <ex><fex name="Speaker">Bill</fex> <t>told</t> me that he would come to the party.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Message
FE.definition: <def-root>The Message is the communication produced by the Speaker. <ex>The authorities <t>informed</t> me <fex name="Message">that my brother had been arrested</fex>.</ex> <ex>I <t>told</t> him <fex name="Message">a bedtime story</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Topic</fen> is a general description of the content of the <fen>Message</fen>. <ex>Leroy <t>told</t> his mother <fex name="Topic">about his arrest</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Manner</fen> describes the way in which the <fen>Speaker</fen> delivers the <fen>Message</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Means</fen> describes the way the <fen>Speaker</fen> accomplishes the task of giving the <fen>Addressee</fen> the <fen>Message</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element is the <fen>Medium</fen> in which the <fen>Message</fen> is expressed.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time period during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> informs the <fen>Addressee</fen> of the <fen>Message</fen>.
<ex>Even when we had a size problem they <t>informed</t> me <fex name="Time">right away</fex> and everything worked out great.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen> informs the <fen>Addressee</fen> of the <fen>Message</fen>.
<ex>She looked at it for a few moments, thinking of Mark Smeaton and what he had <t>told</t> her <fex name="Place">on the steps of City Hall</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies a characteristic or description of the telling event. </def-root>

FE.name: Iteration
FE.definition: <def-root>The frame element Iteration is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: inform.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give facts or information to

lexUnit.name: assure.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: tell someone something positively in order to dispel potential doubts.

lexUnit.name: confide.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: tell someone about a secret or private matter in confidence

lexUnit.name: notify.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: inform, typically in a formal or official manner.

lexUnit.name: notification.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: notifying, informing, typically in a formal or official manner

lexUnit.name: assurance.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a positive declaration intended to give confidence
